page.title: 16GOSS HALL
page.content: Goss Hall bestrides the 700ft. contour line just below the coach road from Overton Hall that joins the Matlock-Chesterfield road. Below it is the valley of the Amber with Ashover village to the right and to the left is Stone Edge and the dark moors of Chatsworth.There are written recordS of this house which is well over 300 years old but no-one seems quite sure if it is Goss Hall or Gorse Hall. In the 17th Century the land belonged to the Perpoynts (now Pierrepont), the Babingtons of Dethick and Sir Thomas Reresby,and possibly, briefly to Sir Walter Raleigh. It is almost certainly Elizabethan and the estate covers 44 acres. One family sold the estate in 1957 driven out,so it is said,by a pipe-smoking ghost whose tobacco smoke filled the house each night.
